events.message: The customer reported a collision involving their car with another vehicle at an intersection on April 30th.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident due to the nature of the reported car collision.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the auto accident claim and contact the policyholder promptly.
The insurance company acknowledged receipt of the car accident claim and confirmed that investigation will start shortly.
The customer was requested to submit photos of the damaged vehicle and a police report related to the collision.
The customer submitted all requested documents including vehicle damage photographs and the official police report.
The claims investigation team began evaluating the circumstances surrounding the car accident claim.
The investigation into the collision was completed, and liability was determined to be partially on the other driver.
A settlement offer was proposed to the customer covering repair costs for their car and additional compensation.
The customer responded with acceptance of the settlement proposal, expressing satisfaction with the resolution process.
The insurance claim was formally approved based on investigation results and customer agreement to the settlement.
The agreed payment was issued to the policyholder to cover the costs associated with the vehicle collision.
Following payment issuance, the auto accident claim was officially closed with all parties informed.
The documentation and details for this auto accident claim were archived for record-keeping and future reference.
